text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with the God, and the Word was God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The same was in the beginning with the God.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things were made by him, and without him was not any thing made that was made.
speaker: Narrator

text: In him was life, and the life was the light of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the light shines in the darkness, and the darkness apprehended it not.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
speaker: Narrator

text: The same came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all men through him might believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was not the Light, but was sent to bear witness of the Light.
speaker: Narrator

text: That Word was the true Light, which lightens every man that comes into this world.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was in the world, and the world was made by him, and the world knew him not.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came unto his own, and his own received him not.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become sons of God, even to them that believe on his name,
speaker: Narrator

text: who are not born of blood, nor of the will of flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Word was made flesh and dwelt among us (and we beheld his glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father), full of grace and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: John bore witness of him and cried, saying, This is he of whom I spoke, He that comes after me is preferred before me, for he was before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of his fullness we have all received, and grace for grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the law was given through Moses, but the grace and the truth of God came through Jesus, the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man has seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, he has declared him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, Who art thou?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he confessed and denied not, but confessed, I am not the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they asked him, What then? Art thou Elijah? And he said, I am not. Art thou the prophet? And he answered, No.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said they unto him, Who art thou? that we may give an answer to those that sent us. What sayest thou of thyself?
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make straight the way of the Lord, as said the prophet Isaiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who were sent were of the Pharisees.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they asked him and said unto him, Why dost thou baptize then if thou art not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the prophet?
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered them, saying, I baptize with water, but there stands one among you, whom ye know not;
speaker: Narrator

text: he it is, who coming after me is preferred before me, whose shoe’s latchet I am not worthy to unloose.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day John saw Jesus coming unto him and said, Behold the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is he of whom I said, After me comes a man who is preferred before me, for he was before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I knew him not; but that he should be made manifest to Israel, therefore am I come baptizing with water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And John gave testimony, saying, I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it abode upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I knew him not; but he that sent me to baptize with water, the same said unto me, Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending and abiding on him, the same is he who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have seen and have given testimony that this is the Son of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again the next day John stood, and two of his disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: and looking upon Jesus as he walked, he said, Behold the Lamb of God!
speaker: Narrator

text: And the two disciples heard him speak and followed Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus turned and saw them following and said unto them, What seek ye? They said unto him, Rabbi (which is to say, being interpreted, Master), where dwellest thou?
speaker: Jesus

text: He said unto them, Come and see. They came and saw where he dwelt and abode with him that day, for it was about the tenth hour.
speaker: Jesus

text: One of the two who heard John speak and followed him was Andrew, brother of Simon Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: He first found his own brother Simon and said unto him, We have found the Messias, which is, being interpreted, the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought him to Jesus. And when Jesus beheld him, he said, Thou art Simon the son of Jonah: thou shalt be called Cephas, which is by interpretation, A stone.
speaker: Jesus

text: The day following Jesus desired to go forth into Galilee and found Philip and said unto him, Follow me.
speaker: Jesus

text: Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip found Nathanael and said unto him, We have found him of whom Moses in the law and the prophets wrote: Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Nathanael said unto him, Can any good thing come out of Nazareth? Philip said unto him, Come and see.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him and said of him, Behold a true Israelite, in whom is no guile!
speaker: Jesus

text: Nathanael said unto him, From where dost thou know me? Jesus answered and said unto him, Before Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.
speaker: Jesus

text: Nathanael answered and said unto him, Rabbi, thou art the Son of God; thou art the King of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Because I said unto thee, I saw thee under the fig tree, believest thou? thou shalt see greater things than these.
speaker: Jesus

text: And he said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Hereafter ye shall see the heaven open and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man.
speaker: Jesus

text: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jesus and his disciples were also called to the marriage.
speaker: Narrator

text: And being short of wine, the mother of Jesus said unto him, They have no wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee? My hour is not yet come.
speaker: Jesus

text: His mother said unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto them, Fill the waterpots with water. And they filled them up to the brim.
speaker: Jesus

text: And he said unto them, Draw out now and bear unto the butler. And they bore it.
speaker: Jesus

text: When the butler had tasted the water that was made wine and knew not where it was from (but the servants who drew the water knew), the butler called the bridegroom
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto him, Every man at the beginning sets forth the good wine, and when they are well satisfied, then that which is worse; but thou hast kept the good wine until now.
speaker: Jesus

text: This beginning of the signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee and manifested forth his glory, and his disciples believed on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this he went down to Capernaum, he and his mother and his brethren and his disciples, and they continued there not many days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem
speaker: Narrator

text: and found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers seated;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep and the oxen, and poured out the changers’ money and overthrew the tables
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto those that sold the doves, Take these things away from here; do not make my Father’s house a house of merchandise.
speaker: Jesus

text: Then his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house has consumed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews answered and said unto him, What sign showest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Dissolve this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.
speaker: Jesus

text: Then said the Jews, This temple was forty-six years in building, and wilt thou raise it up in three days?
speaker: Narrator

text: But he spoke of the temple of his body.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore when he was risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them; and they believed the scripture and the word which Jesus had said.
speaker: Jesus

text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover, in the feast day, many believed in his name, seeing the signs which he did.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus did not trust himself unto them because he knew all men
speaker: Narrator

text: and needed not that any man should give testimony, for he knew what was in man.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a prince of the Jews;
speaker: Narrator

text: the same came to Jesus by night and said unto him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God, for no one can do these signs that thou doest unless God is with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a person be born again from above, he cannot see the kingdom of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: Nicodemus said unto him, How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter the second time into his mother’s womb and be born?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Unless a man is born of water and of the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh, and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again from above.
speaker: Jesus

text: The wind blows where it desires, and thou hearest the sound of it, but canst not tell from where it comes or where it goes; so is every one that is born of the Spirit.
speaker: Jesus

text: Nicodemus answered and said unto him, How can this be done?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Art thou a teacher of Israel and knowest not this?
speaker: Jesus

text: Verily, verily, I say unto thee that we speak what we know and testify that which we have seen, and ye do not receive our witness.
speaker: Jesus

text: If I have told you earthly things and ye do not believe, how shall ye believe if I tell you of heavenly things?
speaker: Jesus

text: And no one has ascended up to the heaven but he that came down from the heaven, even the Son of man, who is in the heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of man be lifted up,
speaker: Jesus

text: that whosoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
speaker: Jesus

text: For God so loved the world that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
speaker: Jesus

text: For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world through him might be saved.
speaker: Jesus

text: He that believes on him is not condemned, but he that does not believe is condemned already because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: And this is the condemnation, that the light is come into the world, and men loved darkness more than the light because their deeds were evil.
speaker: Jesus

text: For every one that does evil hates the light, and does not come to the light, lest his deeds should be reproved.
speaker: Jesus

text: But he that does truth comes to the light, that his deeds may be made manifest, that they are wrought in God.
speaker: Jesus

text: After these things Jesus and his disciples came into the land of Judaea, and he tarried there with them and baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text: And John also was baptizing in Aenon near to Salim because there was much water there, and they came and were baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text: For John was not yet cast into prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then there arose a question between the disciples of John and the Jews about purifying.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came unto John and said unto him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond Jordan of whom thou gave witness, behold, the same baptizes, and all men come to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered and said, A man can receive nothing except it is given him from the heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: Ye yourselves are my witnesses that I said, I am not the Christ, but that I am sent before him.
speaker: Jesus

text: He that has the bride is the bridegroom, but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice; this my joy therefore is fulfilled.
speaker: Jesus

text: It is expedient unto him to increase, but unto me, to decrease.
speaker: Jesus

text: He that comes from above is above all; he that is of the earth is earthly and speaks earthly things: he that comes from heaven is above all.
speaker: Jesus

text: And what he has seen and heard, that he testifies; and no one receives his testimony.
speaker: Jesus

text: He that has received his testimony has set to his seal that God is true.
speaker: Jesus

text: For he whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for God does not give the Spirit by measure unto him.
speaker: Jesus

text: The Father loves the Son and has given all things into his hand.
speaker: Jesus

text: He that believes in the Son has eternal life, and he that does not obey the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God abides on him.
speaker: Jesus

text: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John
speaker: Narrator

text: (though Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples),
speaker: Narrator

text: he left Judaea and departed again into Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was necessary that he go through Samaria.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he came to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jacob’s well was there. Jesus, therefore, being wearied with his journey, sat thus on the well; and it was about the sixth hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: There came a woman of Samaria to draw water; Jesus said unto her, Give me to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy food.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the Samaritan woman unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, who am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of God and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink, thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep; from where then hast thou that living water?
speaker: Narrator

text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well and drank thereof himself, and his sons and his cattle?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said unto her, Whosoever drinks of this water shall thirst again,
speaker: Narrator

text: but whosoever drinks of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst, but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a fountain of water springing up into eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said unto him, Lord, give me this water, that I not thirst, neither come here to draw.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto her, Go, call thy husband and come here.
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus said unto her, Thou hast well said, I have no husband;
speaker: Narrator

text: for thou hast had five husbands, and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband; this hast thou said with truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said unto him, Lord, I perceive that thou art a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain, and ye say that in Jerusalem is the place where it is necessary to worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto her, Woman, believe me, the hour comes when neither in this mountain nor in Jerusalem shall ye worship the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye worship what ye know not; we worship what we know, for saving health is of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the hour comes, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth, for the Father seeks such to worship him.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is a Spirit and those that worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said unto him, I know that the Messiah is to come, who is called the Christ; when he is come, he will declare unto us all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto her, I AM that speak unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And upon this came his disciples and marvelled that he talked with that woman; yet no one said, What askest thou? or, What talkest thou with her?
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman then left her waterpot and went into the city and said to those men,
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, see a man who told me all that I have done; is perchance this the Christ?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they went out of the city and came unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the meanwhile his disciples entreated him, saying, Rabbi, eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said unto them, I have a food to eat that ye know not of.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore said the disciples one to another, Has anyone brought him anything to eat?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto them, My food is to do the will of him that sent me and to finish his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do ye not say, There are yet four months and then comes harvest? Behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes and look on the fields, for they are white already to harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that reaps receives wages and gathers fruit unto eternal life, that both he that sows and he that reaps may rejoice together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And herein is that saying true, One sows and another reaps.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sent you to reap that upon which ye bestowed no labour; others laboured, and ye have entered into their labours.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed in him by the word of the woman, who testified, He told me all that I have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the Samaritans were come unto him, they asked him to abide with them; and he abode there two days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many more believed by his own word
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy speech; for we have heard him ourselves and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Saviour of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after two days he departed from that place and went into Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honour in his own country.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then when he was come into Galilee, the Galilaeans received him, having seen all the things that he had done in Jerusalem at the feast, for they had also gone to the feast.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where he had made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman whose son was sick at Capernaum.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee, he went unto him and besought him that he would come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said unto him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will not believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: The nobleman said unto him, Sir, come down before my child dies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto him, Go; thy son lives. And the man believed the word that Jesus spoke unto him, and he went.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he was now going down, his slaves met him and told him, saying, Thy son lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he enquired of them the hour when he began to get better. And they said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the father knew that it was at the same hour in which Jesus said unto him, Thy son lives; and he believed, and his whole house.
speaker: Narrator

text: This again is the second sign that Jesus did when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in Jerusalem there is a pool by the sheep gate, which in Hebrew is called, Bethesda, having five porches.
speaker: Narrator

text: In these lay a great multitude of those who were sick, blind, halt, withered, waiting for the moving of the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: For an angel went down at a certain time into the pool and troubled the water; whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatever disease he had.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a certain man was there who had an infirmity thirty-eight years.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw him lying there and knew that he had been now a long time in that case, he said unto him, Dost thou desire to be made whole?
speaker: Narrator

text: The impotent man answered him, Sir, I have no man when the water is troubled to put me into the pool, but while I am coming, another steps down before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto him, Rise, take up thy bed, and walk.
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately the man was made whole and took up his bed and walked, and on that day was the sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured, It is the sabbath day; it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take up thy bed and walk.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they asked him, Who is the man that said unto thee, Take up thy bed and walk?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that was healed did not know who it was; for Jesus had conveyed himself away, a multitude being in that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Jesus found him in the temple and said unto him, Behold, thou art made whole; sin no more, lest a worse thing come unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man departed and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him whole.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for this reason the Jews persecuted Jesus and sought to kill him: because he had done these things on a sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus answered them, My Father works until now, and I work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only had broken the sabbath but also called God his own Father, making himself equal with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus answered and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself but what he sees the Father do; for all that he does, this also the Son does together with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Father loves the Son and shows him all the things that he does, and he will show him greater works than these that ye may marvel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the Father raises up the dead and gives them life; even so the Son gives life unto whom he will.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Father judges no man but has committed all judgment unto the Son
speaker: Narrator

text: that everyone should honour the Son, even as they honour the Father. He that does not honour the Son does not honour the Father who has sent him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that hears my word and believes him that sent me has eternal life and shall not come into judgment but has passed from death unto life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour shall come, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God, and they that hear shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the Father has life in himself, so has he given to the Son to have life in himself
speaker: Narrator

text: and has also given him power and authority to execute judgment because he is the Son of man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Marvel not at this, for an hour shall come when all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: and those that have done good shall come forth unto the resurrection of life; but those that have done evil, unto the resurrection of judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: I can of my own self do nothing; as I hear, I judge, and my judgment is just because I seek not my own will, but the will of the Father who has sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is another that bears witness of me, and I know that the witness which he witnesses of me is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye sent unto John, and he bore witness unto the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I receive not testimony from man, but I say these things that ye might be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was a burning and a shining light, and ye were willing to rejoice for one hour in his light.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have greater testimony than that of John; for the works which the Father has given me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of me that the Father has sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Father himself, who has sent me, has borne witness of me. Ye have neither heard his voice at any time nor seen his appearance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye do not have his word abiding in you; for whom he has sent, him ye do not believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Search the scriptures, for in them ye think ye have eternal life; and they are those who testify of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye will not come to me, that ye might have life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not receive glory from men.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I know you that ye have not the love of God in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have come in my Father’s name, and ye receive me not; if another shall come in his own name, him ye will receive.
speaker: Narrator

text: How can ye believe, who take glory one from another, and seek not the glory that comes only from God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father; there is one that accuses you, even Moses, in whom ye trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed me, for he wrote of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye do not believe his writings, how shall ye believe my words?
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which is the sea of Tiberias.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a great multitude followed him because they saw his signs which he did on the sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus went up into a mountain, and he sat there with his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the passover, the feast of the Jews, was near.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus lifted up his eyes and saw a great company come unto him; he said unto Philip, From where shall we buy bread that these may eat?
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said this to prove him, for he knew what he would do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip answered him, Two hundred denarius of bread is not sufficient for them, that each one of them may take a little.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said unto him,
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a lad here, who has five barley loaves and two small fishes, but what are they among so many?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said, Make the men sit down. Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus took the loaves, and when he had given thanks, he distributed to the disciples and the disciples to those that were sitting down; and likewise of the fishes as much as they desired.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they were filled, he said unto his disciples, Gather up the fragments that remain that nothing be lost.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they gathered them together and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves which were left over from those that had eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then those men, as they had seen the sign that Jesus did, said, This is of a truth the prophet that was to come into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus therefore knowing that they would come and take him by force to make him king, he departed again into a mountain himself alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when evening was come, his disciples went down unto the sea
speaker: Narrator

text: and entered into a ship and were crossing the sea toward Capernaum. And it was now dark, and Jesus had not come to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when they had rowed about twenty-five or thirty furlongs, they saw Jesus walking upon the sea and drawing nigh unto the ship, and they were afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said unto them, I AM; be not afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they willingly received him into the ship, and immediately the ship was at the land where they went.
speaker: Narrator

text: The day following when the multitude which was on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there except the one in which his disciples had entered and that Jesus had not gone with his disciples into the boat, but that his disciples had gone away alone
speaker: Narrator

text: (but other boats came from Tiberias near unto the place where they ate bread after the Lord had given thanks);
speaker: Narrator

text: when the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there, nor his disciples, they also entered into the boats and came to Capernaum, seeking for Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him, Rabbi, when didst thou come here?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye seek me, not because ye have seen the signs, but because ye ate of the loaves and were filled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Labour not for the food which perishes, but for the food which abides unto eternal life, which the Son of man shall give unto you, for him has God the Father sealed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said unto him, What shall we do that we might work the works of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said unto them, This is the work of God, that ye believe in him whom he has sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said therefore unto him, What sign showest thou then that we may see and believe thee? what dost thou work?
speaker: Narrator

text: Our fathers ate manna in the desert, as it is written, He gave them of the bread from the heaven to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Moses gave you not that bread from the heaven, but my Father gives you the true bread from the heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the bread of God is he who descended from heaven and gives life unto the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said they unto him, Lord, always give us this bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said unto them, I AM the bread of life; he that comes to me shall never hunger, and he that believes in me shall never thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said unto you, That even though ye have seen me, ye do not believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that the Father gives me shall come to me, and he that comes to me I will in no wise cast out.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I came down from the heaven, not to do my own will, but the will of him that sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the Father’s will who has sent me, that of all whom he has given me I should lose nothing but should raise it up again in the last day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the will of him that sent me, That every one who sees the Son and believes in him may have eternal life, and I will raise him up in the last day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews then murmured of him because he said, I AM the bread which descended from the heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How is it then that he says, I descended from heaven?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them, Murmur not among yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one can come to me unless the Father who has sent me draws him, and I will raise him up in the last day.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is written in the prophets, And they shall all be taught of God. Every man therefore that has heard from the Father and has learned comes unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except he who is of God, he has seen the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believes in me has eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I AM the bread of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your fathers ate manna in the wilderness and are dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the bread which comes down from heaven, that anyone may eat of it and not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: I AM the living bread which came down from heaven; if anyone eats of this bread, they shall live for ever; and the bread that I will give is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews therefore contended among themselves, saying, How is he able to give us his flesh to eat?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Unless ye eat the flesh of the Son of man and drink his blood, ye shall have no life in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my flesh is food indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that eats my flesh and drinks my blood abides in me, and I in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the living Father has sent me, and I live by the Father, so he that eats me, he shall also live by me.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the bread which came down from heaven; not as your fathers ate manna and are dead; he that eats of this bread shall live eternally.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said these things in the synagogue as he taught in Capernaum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many therefore of his disciples when they had heard this said, This is a hard word; who can hear it?
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, knowing in himself that his disciples murmured at it, said unto them, Does this offend you?
speaker: Narrator

text: What if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Spirit is he that gives life; the flesh profits nothing; the words that I have spoken unto you, they are Spirit and they are life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there are some of you that do not believe. For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that did not believe and who should betray him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Therefore I said unto you that no one can come unto me unless it is given unto them of my Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, many of his disciples went back and walked no more with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said unto the twelve, Will ye also go away?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go? thou hast the words of eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we believe and know that thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, Have not I chosen you twelve, and one of you is a devil?
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke of Judas Iscariot the son of Simon, for it was he that should betray him, being one of the twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee, for he would not walk in Judea because the Jews sought to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the feast of the Jews, of the tabernacles, was at hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: His brethren therefore said unto him, Depart from this place and go into Judea that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest.
speaker: Narrator

text: For no one who seeks to be clearly known does anything in secret. If thou doest these things, show thyself to the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: For not even his brethren believed in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said unto them, My time is not yet come, but your time is always ready.
speaker: Narrator

text: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me because I testify of it that its works are evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go ye up unto this feast; I go not up yet unto this feast, for my time is not yet fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And having said these things unto them, he abode still in Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when his brethren were gone up, then he also went up unto the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews sought him at the feast and said, Where is he?
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him, for some said, He is a good man; others said, No, but he deceives the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But no one spoke openly of him for fear of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple and taught.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Jews marvelled, saying, How does this man know letters, having never learned?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them and said, My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone desires to do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it is of God or whether I speak of myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that speaks of himself seeks his own glory, but he that seeks the glory of him that sent him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did not Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keeps the law? Why do ye go about to kill me?
speaker: Narrator

text: The people answered and said, Thou hast a demon; who goes about to kill thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said unto them, I have done one work, and ye all marvel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision (not because it is of Moses, but of the fathers), and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man on the sabbath day receives circumcision without the law of Moses being broken, are ye angry at me because I have made a man entirely whole on the sabbath day?
speaker: Narrator

text: Judge not according to the appearance, but judge with righteous judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then one of those of Jerusalem said, Is not this he whom they seek to kill?
speaker: Narrator

text: But, behold, he speaks boldly, and they say nothing unto him. Have the rulers truly understood that this is indeed the Christ?
speaker: Narrator

text: But we know where this man is from; but when the Christ comes, no one shall know where he is from.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus cried out in the temple as he taught, saying, Ye know me, and ye know from where I come, but I have not come of myself, but he that sent me is true, whom ye know not.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I know him, for I am from him, and he has sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they sought to take him, but no one laid hands on him because his hour was not yet come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many of the people believed in him and said, When the Christ comes, will he do more signs than these which this man has done?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees heard the people that murmured such things concerning him, and the princes of the priests and the Pharisees sent officers to take him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said unto them, Yet a little while I shall be with you, and then I shall go unto him that sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall seek me and shall not find me, and where I shall be, ye shall not be able to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews said among themselves, Where will he go that we shall not find him? Will he go unto the dispersed among the Greeks and teach the Greeks?
speaker: Narrator

text: What manner of saying is this that he said, Ye shall seek me and shall not find me, and where I shall be ye shall not be able to come?
speaker: Narrator

text: In the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, saying, If any man thirsts, let him come unto me and drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that believes in me, as the scripture has said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.
speaker: Narrator

text: (But this he spoke concerning the Spirit, which those that believe on him should receive, for the Holy Spirit was not yet given because Jesus was not yet glorified.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then many of the people, when they heard this word, said, Truly this is the Prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Others said, This is the Christ. But some said, Shall the Christ come out of Galilee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Has not the scripture said, That the Christ comes of the seed of David and out of the town of Bethlehem where David was?
speaker: Narrator

text: So there was a division among the people because of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of them would have taken him, but no one laid hands on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees came, and they said unto them, Why have ye not brought him?
speaker: Narrator

text: The officers answered, Never has anyone spoken like this man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Pharisees answered them, Are ye also deceived?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have any of the princes or of the Pharisees believed on him?
speaker: Narrator

text: But this people who do not know the law are cursed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nicodemus said unto them (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them),
speaker: Narrator

text: Does our law judge any man before it hears him and knows what he does?
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered and said unto him, Art thou also of Galilee? Search and see, for a prophet has never arisen out of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And each one went unto his own house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went unto the mount of Olives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And early in the morning he came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him; and he sat down and taught them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery, and when they had set her in the midst,
speaker: Narrator

text: they said unto him, Master, this woman was taken in adultery in the very act.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Moses in the law commanded us that such should be stoned, but what sayest thou?
speaker: Narrator

text: This they said, tempting him, that they might be able to accuse him. But Jesus stooped down and with his finger wrote on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when they continued asking him, he lifted himself up and said unto them, He that is without sin among you, let him be the first to cast a stone at her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again he stooped down and wrote on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who heard it, being convicted by their own conscience, went out one by one, beginning at the eldest even unto the last; and Jesus was left alone and the woman that had been in the midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, lifting himself up and seeing no one but the woman, said unto her, Woman, where are thine accusers? Has no one condemned thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said, No one, Lord. Then Jesus said unto her, Neither do I condemn thee; go and sin no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus spoke again unto them, saying, I AM the light of the world; he that follows me shall not walk in darkness but shall have the light of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Pharisees said unto him, Thou dost bear witness of thyself; thy witness is not true.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Though I bear witness of myself, my witness is true, for I know from where I came and where I go; but ye do not know where I came from and where I go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye judge after the flesh, but I judge no one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet if I judge, my judgment is true, for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is also written in your law that the testimony of two men is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: I AM one that bears witness of myself, and the Father that sent me bears witness of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said unto him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered, Ye neither know me, nor my Father; if ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus spoke these words in the treasury as he taught in the temple, and no one laid hands on him, for his hour was not yet come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said again unto them, I am going away, and ye shall seek me, but ye shall die in your sins; where I go, ye shall not be able to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews said, Will he kill himself? because he says, Where I go, ye shall not be able to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Ye are from below, I am from above; ye are of this world, I am not of this world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I said unto you that ye shall die in your sins, for if ye do not believe that I AM, ye shall die in your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And said they unto him, Who art thou? Then Jesus said unto them, He that I said unto you also from the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have many things to say and to judge regarding you, but he that sent me is true; and those things which I have heard of him, I speak in the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they did not understand that he spoke to them of the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said unto them, When ye have lifted up the Son of man, then ye shall know that I AM and that I do nothing of myself, but as my Father has taught me, I speak these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that sent me is with me: the Father has not left me alone, for I always do those things that please him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he spoke these words, many believed in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to those Jews who had believed him, If ye abide in my word, ye shall be my disciples indeed;
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall set you free.
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered him, We are Abraham’s seed, and we have never served anyone; how sayest thou, Ye shall be set free?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever commits sin is the slave of sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the slave does not abide in the house for ever, but the Son abides for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the Son therefore shall set you free, ye shall be free indeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know that ye are Abraham’s seed, but ye seek to kill me because my word has no place in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I speak that which I have seen with my Father, and ye do that which ye have seen with your father.
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered and said unto him, Abraham is our father. Jesus said unto them, If ye were Abraham’s sons, ye would do the works of Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now ye seek to kill me, a man that has told you the truth, which I have heard of God; Abraham did not do this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye do the deeds of your father. Then they said to him, We are not born of fornication; we have one Father, even God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto them, If God were your Father, ye would surely love me, for I proceeded forth and came from God; neither did I come of myself, but he sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do ye not understand my speech? even because ye cannot hear my word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye are of your father the devil, and the desires of your father ye desire to do. He was a murderer from the beginning and abode not in the truth because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks of his own, for he is a liar and the father of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And because I tell you the truth, ye do not believe me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which of you reproves me of sin? And if I say the truth, why do ye not believe me?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that is of God hears God’s words; ye therefore hear them not because ye are not of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews answered, and said unto him, Do we not say well that thou art a Samaritan and hast a demon?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, I do not have a demon; but I honour my Father, and ye do dishonour me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I seek not my own glory; there is one that seeks it and judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, If anyone keeps my word, he shall not see death forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews said unto him, Now we know that thou hast a demon. Abraham died and the prophets; and thou sayest, If a man keeps my word, he shall not taste death forever?
speaker: Narrator

text: Art thou greater than our father Abraham who died? and the prophets died; whom makest thou thyself?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing; it is my Father that glorifies me, of whom ye say that he is your God;
speaker: Narrator

text: yet ye have not known him, but I know him; and if I should say, I do not know him, I shall be a liar like unto you; but I know him and keep his word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day, and he saw it and was glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews said unto him, Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I AM.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they took up stones to cast at him, but Jesus concealed himself and went out of the temple, and going through the midst of them, went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as Jesus passed by, he saw a man who was blind from his birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his disciples asked him, saying, Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, Neither has this man sinned nor his parents, but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is expedient that I do the works of him that sent me while it is day; the night comes, when no one can work.
speaker: Narrator

text: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground and made clay of the spittle, and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto him, Go, wash in the pool of Siloam (which is by interpretation, Sent). Then he went and washed and came back seeing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The neighbours, therefore, and those who before had seen him that he was blind said, Is not this he that sat and begged?
speaker: Narrator

text: Some said, This is he; others said, He is like him; but he said, I am he.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said unto him, How were thine eyes opened?
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered and said, A man that is called Jesus made clay and anointed my eyes and said unto me, Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash; and I went and washed, and I received sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said they unto him, Where is he? He said, I know not.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought to the Pharisees him that beforehand had been blind.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus had made the clay and had opened his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them, He put clay upon my eyes, and I washed and do see.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore some of the Pharisees said, This man is not of God because he does not keep the sabbath day. Others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such signs? And there was a division among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that has opened thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Jews did not believe concerning him that he had been blind and received his sight until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, who ye say was born blind? how then does he now see?
speaker: Narrator

text: His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son and that he was born blind;
speaker: Narrator

text: but by what means he now sees, we know not; or who has opened his eyes, we know not; he is of age, ask him; he shall speak for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: These words spoke his parents because they feared the Jews, for the Jews had agreed already that if anyone did confess that he was the Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore his parents said, He is of age, ask him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they called again the man that had been blind and said unto him, Give glory to God; we know that this man is a sinner.
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered and said, Whether he is a sinner or not, I do not know; one thing I know, that having been blind, now I see.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said they to him again, What did he do to thee? How did he open thine eyes?
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, I have told you already, and ye have heard; what more would ye hear? Do ye also desire to be his disciples?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they reviled him and said, Be thou his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that God spoke unto Moses; as for this fellow, we do not know where he is from.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man answered and said unto them, Indeed this is a marvellous thing that ye do not know where he is from, and yet he has opened my eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we know that God does not hear sinners, but if anyone should fear God and do his will, him he will hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since the world began it has not been heard of that anyone opened the eyes of one that was born blind.
speaker: Narrator

text: If this man were not of God, he could do nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and finding him, he said unto him, Dost thou believe in the Son of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe in him?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said unto him, Thou hast seen him, and it is he that talks with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said, For judgment I have come into this world, that those who do not see might see and that those who see might be blinded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of the Pharisees who were with him heard these words and said unto him, Are we blind also?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto them, If ye were blind, ye should have no sin; but now because ye say, We see, therefore your sin abides.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that enters not by the door into the sheepfold, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he that enters in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: To him the porter opens, and the sheep hear his voice, and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he puts forth his own sheep, he goes before them; and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.
speaker: Narrator
