speaker: Narrator

text: Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abides in the vine, no more can ye, except ye abide in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I AM the vine, ye are the branches: he that abides in me, and I in him, the same brings forth much fruit; for without me ye can do nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who does not abide in me shall be cast forth as an unsound branch and shall wither, and they are gathered and cast into the fire and are burned.
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye abide in me and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this is my Father clarified, in that ye bear much fruit; and in this manner ye shall be my disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Father has loved me, so I have loved you; abide in my love.
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love, even as I have kept my Father’s commandments and abide in his love.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things I have spoken unto you that my joy may abide in you and that your joy might be fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is my commandment, That ye love one another as I have loved you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greater love has no man than this, that a man lay down his soul for his friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye are my friends if ye do whatsoever I command you.
speaker: Narrator

text: From now on I do not call you slaves, for the slave does not know what his lord does; but I have called you friends, for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you and ordained you, that ye should go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should remain; that whatever ye shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: This I command you, that ye love one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the world hates you, ye know that it hated me before it hated you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye were of the world, the world would love its own; but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the word that I said unto you, The slave is not greater than his lord. If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they have kept my word, they will keep yours also.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they will do all these things unto you for my name’s sake, because they do not know him that sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I had not come and spoken unto them, they would not have sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that hates me hates my Father also.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I had not done among them works which no other man has done, they would not have sin; but now they have seen them and hate both me and my Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this comes to pass that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law, They hated me without a cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of truth, which proceeds from the Father, he shall testify of me;
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye also shall bear witness because ye have been with me from the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things I have spoken unto you that ye should not be offended.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall put you out of the synagogues, and the hour will even come when whosoever kills you will think that he does God service.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will do these things unto you because they do not know the Father, nor me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have told you these things that when that hour shall come, ye may remember that I told you of them. And I did not say these things unto you at the beginning because I was with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now I go unto him that sent me, and none of you asks me, Where goest thou?
speaker: Narrator

text: But because I have said these things unto you, sorrow has filled your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth: It is expedient for you that I go away; for if I do not go away, the Comforter will not come unto you; but if I depart, I will send him unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin and of righteousness and of judgment:
speaker: Narrator

text: of sin, because they do not believe in me;
speaker: Narrator

text: of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye see me no more;
speaker: Narrator

text: of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth, for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoever he shall hear, that shall he speak, and he will cause you to know the things which are to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall clarify me, for he shall take of that which is mine and shall cause you to know it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that the Father has is mine; therefore I said that he shall take of that which is mine and shall cause you to know it.
speaker: Narrator

text: A little while, and ye shall not see me; and again, a little while, and ye shall see me, because I go to the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some of his disciples said among themselves, What is this that he says unto us, A little while, and ye shall not see me; and again, a little while, and ye shall see me; and, Because I go to the Father?
speaker: Narrator

text: They said therefore, What is this that he says, A little while? we cannot understand what he says.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him and said unto them, Do ye enquire among yourselves of what I said, A little while, and ye shall not see me; and again, a little while, and ye shall see me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, That ye shall weep and lament, and the world shall rejoice; but even though ye shall be sorrowful, your sorrow shall be turned into joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman, when she is in travail, has pain, because her hour is come; but as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembers the anguish no more, for joy that a man is born into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye now therefore have sorrow; but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and no one shall take your joy from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day ye shall ask me nothing. Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whatever ye shall ask the Father in my name, he will give you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until now ye have asked nothing in my name; ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have spoken these things unto you in proverbs, but the hour comes when I shall no longer speak unto you in proverbs, but I shall show you plainly of the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day ye shall ask in my name, and I do not say unto you that I will ask the Father for you;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the Father himself loves you because ye have loved me and have believed that I came out from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I came forth from the Father and am come into the world; again, I leave the world and go to the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples said unto him, Behold, now thou speakest plainly and speakest no proverb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we understand that thou knowest all things and needest not that anyone should ask thee; by this we believe that thou didst come forth from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, Do ye now believe?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the hour comes and is now come, that ye shall be scattered, each one to his own, and shall leave me alone; and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things I have spoken unto you that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation; but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus spoke these words and lifted up his eyes to heaven and said, Father, the hour is come; clarify thy Son, that thy Son may also clarify thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: as thou hast given him power over all flesh, that he should give eternal life to as many as thou hast given him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is life eternal, that they might know thee the only true God and Jesus Christ, whom thou hast sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have clarified thee on the earth; I have finished the work which thou didst give me to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, O Father, clarify thou me with thine own self with that clarity which I had with thee before the world was.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have manifested thy name unto the men which thou didst give me out of the world; thine they were, and thou didst give them me; and they have kept thy word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they have known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me; and they have received them and have known surely that I came out from thee, and they have believed that thou didst send me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray for them; I do not pray for the world, but for those whom thou hast given me; for they are thine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all my things are thine, and thine are mine; and I have been clarified in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now I am no longer in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, those whom thou hast given me, keep them in thy name, that they may be one, as we are.
speaker: Narrator

text: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in thy name; those that thou gavest me I have kept, and none of them is lost, but the son of perdition, that the scripture might be fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now I come to thee; and these things I speak in the world that they might have my joy fulfilled in themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have given them thy word, and the world has hated them because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not pray that thou should take them out of the world, but that thou should keep them from the evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sanctify them in thy truth; thy word is the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As thou hast sent me into the world, even so have I also sent them into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for their sakes I sanctify myself, that they also might be sanctified in the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither do I pray for these alone, but also for those who shall believe in me through their word;
speaker: Narrator

text: that they all may be one; as thou, Father, art in me, and I in thee, that they also may be one in us, that the world may believe that thou hast sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the clarity which thou gavest me I have given them, that they may be one, even as we are one:
speaker: Narrator

text: I in them, and thou in me, that they may be perfect in one and that the world may know that thou hast sent me and hast loved them as thou hast loved me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Father, I will that they also, whom thou hast given me, be with me where I am, that they may behold my clarity, which thou hast given me, for thou hast loved me from before the foundation of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: O righteous Father, the world has not known thee; but I have known thee, and these have known that thou hast sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have manifested unto them thy name and will manifest it still, that the love with which thou hast loved me may be in them, and I in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had spoken these things, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron, where there was a garden, into which he entered, and his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judas also, who betrayed him, knew the place: for Jesus gathered there often with his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judas then, taking a company of soldiers and ministers of the high priests and of the Pharisees, came there with lanterns and torches and weapons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus therefore, knowing all the things that should come upon him, went forth, and said unto them, Whom seek ye?
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered him, Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus said unto them, I AM. And Judas also, who betrayed him, stood with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he said unto them, I AM, they went backward and fell to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he asked them again, Whom seek ye? And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, I have told you that I AM; if, therefore, ye seek me, let these go away,
speaker: Narrator

text: that the word might be fulfilled, which he spoke, Of those whom thou gavest me I have lost none.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it and smote the high priest’s slave and cut off his right ear. The slave’s name was Malchus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said unto Peter, Put up thy sword into the sheath; the cup which my Father has given me, shall I not drink it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the company of soldiers and the tribune and the ministers of the Jews took Jesus and bound him
speaker: Narrator

text: and led him away to Annas first, for he was father-in-law to Caiaphas, who was the high priest of that year and he sent him bound unto Caiaphas, the high priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Caiaphas was he who had given the counsel to the Jews that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple; that disciple was known unto the high priest and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter stood at the door without. Then that other disciple, who was known unto the high priest, went out and spoke unto her that kept the door and brought in Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the damsel that kept the door said unto Peter, Art not thou also one of this man’s disciples? He said, I am not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the slaves and servants stood there, who had made a fire of coals, for it was cold, and they warmed themselves; and Peter stood with them and warmed himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: The high priest then asked Jesus of his disciples and of his doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, I spoke openly to the world; I always taught in the synagogue and in the temple, where all the Jews gather; and I have said nothing in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why dost thou ask me? Ask those who heard me what I have said unto them; behold, they know what I said.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had thus spoken, one of the servants who stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, Answerest thou the high priest so?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil, but if well, why dost thou smite me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Annas sent him bound unto Caiaphas the high priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Simon Peter stood and warmed himself. They said therefore unto him, Art not thou also one of his disciples? He denied it and said, I am not.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the slaves of the high priest, kinsman of the one whose ear Peter had cut off, said, Did I not see thee in the garden with him?
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter then denied again, and immediately the cock crew.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then led they Jesus from Caiaphas unto the hall of judgment, and it was early; and they themselves did not go into the judgment hall, lest they should be defiled, but that they might eat the passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate then went out unto them and said, What accusation bring ye against this man?
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered and said unto him, If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him up unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate said unto them, Take him, and judge him according to your law. The Jews therefore said unto him, It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death;
speaker: Narrator

text: that the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spoke, signifying what death he should die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate entered into the judgment hall again and called Jesus and said unto him, Art thou the King of the Jews?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, Sayest thou this thing of thyself, or did others tell it unto thee of me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate answered, Am I a Jew? Thine own nation and the chief priests have delivered thee unto me; what hast thou done?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world; if my kingdom were of this world, then my servants would fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews; now, therefore, my kingdom is not from here.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate therefore said unto him, Art thou a king then? Jesus answered, Thou sayest that I AM king. To this end I was born, and for this cause I came into the world, that I should bear witness unto the truth. Every one that is of the truth hears my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate said unto him, What is truth? And when he had said this, he went out again unto the Jews, and said unto them, I find no fault at all in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye have a custom, that I should release unto you one at the passover; will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they all cried again, saying, Not this man, but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was a robber.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate, therefore, took Jesus and scourged him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and they put a purple robe on him
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, Hail, King of the Jews! and they smote him with their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate therefore went forth again and said unto them, Behold, I bring him forth to you, that ye may know that I find no fault in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus came forth, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. And Pilate said unto them, Behold the man!
speaker: Narrator

text: When the princes of the priests and the servants saw him, they cried out, saying, crucify him, crucify him. {Gr. stauroo – hang him on a stake} Pilate said unto them, Take him, and crucify him, for I find no fault in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by our law he ought to die because he made himself the Son of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore when Pilate heard that word, he was the more afraid
speaker: Narrator

text: and went again into the judgment hall and said unto Jesus, Where art thou from? But Jesus gave him no answer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate said unto him, Speakest thou not unto me? knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee {Gr. stauroo – hang thee on a stake} and have power to release thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, Thou could have no power at all against me, unless it were given thee from above; therefore he that delivered me unto thee has the greater sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from then on Pilate sought to release him, but the Jews cried out, saying, If thou let this man go, thou art not Caesar’s friend; whosoever makes himself a king speaks against Caesar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore when Pilate heard that word, he brought Jesus forth and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called the Pavement, but in the Hebrew, Gabbatha.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was the preparation of the passover and about the sixth hour; then he said unto the Jews, Behold your King!
speaker: Narrator

text: But they cried out, Away with him, away with him, crucify him. Pilate said unto them, Shall I crucify your King? The high priests answered, We have no king but Caesar.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that then, he delivered him unto them to be crucified. And they took Jesus and led him away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he, bearing his cross, {Gr. stauros – stake} went forth into a place called the place of a skull, which is called in the Hebrew, Golgotha,
speaker: Narrator

text: where they crucified him and two others with him, one on either side and Jesus in the middle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate also wrote a title and put it above the cross. {Gr. stauros – stake} And the writing was, JESUS OF NAZARETH THE KING OF THE JEWS.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near to the city; and it was written in Hebrew and Greek and Latin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the high priests of the Jews said to Pilate, Write not, The King of the Jews, but that he said, I AM King of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate answered, What I have written I have written.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments and made four parts (to each soldier a part); and also his coat: now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said therefore among themselves, Let us not rend it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be; that the scripture might be fulfilled, which says, They parted my garments among them, and for my raiment they did cast lots. These things therefore the soldiers did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there stood by the cross {Gr. stauros – stake} of Jesus his mother and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Cleophas, and Mary Magdalene.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus therefore saw his mother and the disciple standing by, whom he loved, he said unto his mother, Woman, behold thy son!
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to the disciple, Behold thy mother! And from that hour that disciple took her unto his own home.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Jesus knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the scripture might be fulfilled, said, I thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was set a vessel full of vinegar, and they filled a sponge with vinegar and put it upon hyssop and put it to his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished, and he bowed his head and gave up the Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews therefore, because it was the preparation, that the bodies should not remain upon the cross {Gr. stauros – stake} on the sabbath day (for that sabbath day was a high day) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken and that they might be taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and of the other who were crucified with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was dead already, they did not break his legs,

text: but one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and forthwith blood and water came out.

text: And he that saw it gives testimony, and his testimony is true, and he knows that he says the truth, that ye also might believe.

text: Then Nicodemus came also, who at the first came to Jesus by night, and brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about one hundred pounds.

text: Then Jesus said to them again, Peace be unto you; as my Father has sent me, even so send I you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had said this, he breathed on them and said unto them, Receive ye the Holy Spirit;
speaker: Narrator

text: unto those whose sins ye release, they shall be released; and unto those whose sins ye retain, they shall be retained.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: And again eight days later, his disciples were within and Thomas with them; then Jesus came, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst and said, Peace be unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to Thomas, Reach here thy finger and behold my hands and reach here thy hand and thrust it into my side and be not unbelieving, but faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thomas answered and said unto him, My Lord and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto him, Thomas, because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed; blessed are those that have not seen and yet have believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus truly did many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book;
speaker: Narrator

text: but these are written that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing ye might have life in his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things Jesus manifested himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias, and he manifested himself in this manner:
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter and Thomas, called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee and the sons of Zebedee and two other of his disciples were together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter said unto them, I am going fishing. They said unto him, Let us also go with thee. They went forth and entered into a ship immediately, and that night they caught nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the morning was now come, Jesus stood on the shore, but the disciples did not understand that it was Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said unto them, Children, have ye any food? They answered him, No.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Cast the net on the right hand side of the ship, and ye shall find. They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved said unto Peter, It is the Lord. Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girt his fisher’s coat unto him (for he was naked) and cast himself into the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the other disciples came in the little ship (for they were not far from land, but as it were two hundred cubits), dragging the net with the fishes.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon then as they were come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and a fish laid thereon, and bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto them, Bring of the fish which ye have now caught.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter went up and drew the net to land full of great fishes, one hundred and fifty-three; and being so many, yet the net was not broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto them, Come and dine. And none of the disciples dared to ask him, Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus then came and took the bread and gave them, and the fish likewise.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was now the third time that Jesus manifested himself to his disciples, after he was risen from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when they had dined, Jesus said to Simon Peter, Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me more than these? He said unto him, Yes, Lord, thou knowest that I love thee. He said unto him, Feed my lambs.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to him again the second time, Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me? He said unto him, Yes, Lord thou knowest that I love thee. He said unto him, Feed my sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said unto him the third time, Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me? Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time, Lovest thou me? And he said, Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus said unto him, Feed my sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, When thou wast young, thou didst gird thyself and walk where thou wouldest, but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee and carry thee where thou wouldest not.
speaker: Narrator

text: This he spoke, signifying by what death he should clarify God. And when he had spoken this, he said unto him, Follow me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter, turning about, saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also leaned on his breast at supper, and said, Lord, which is he that betrays thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter seeing him said to Jesus, Lord, and what shall this man do?
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said unto him, If I will that he tarry until I come, what is that to thee? follow thou me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then this saying went abroad among the brethren that that disciple should not die; yet Jesus did not say unto him, He shall not die, but, If I will that he tarry until I come, what is that to thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the disciple who testifies of these things and wrote these things, and we know that his testimony is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there are also many other things which Jesus did, which, if they should be written every one, I think that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
